metadata.title: CVE-2021-30589 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in Sharing in Google Chromeprior to 92.0.4515.107 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigationrestrictions via a crafted click-to-call link.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30589` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0.4515.159-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
